John pretty much sums up the problem.

The way I've dealt with this has bee=
n on a case by case basis. Each time we detect this situation, we override =
the frontier's "force-queue-assignment" setting to ensure that all the doma=
ins are dumped in the same politeness bucket. 

This is quite simple when y=
ou are dealing with a multitude of sub-domains as you can just throw in the=
 override on the parent domain. 

- Kris
